captions.text:
Take a shot with this Paladin Pistol Replica
and hide your face with a Psycho Bandit Mask,
which is better than having No Face...decal.
I'm Jake and this is episode #12 of Game LÜT.

Stay warm with a Pokéball Hoodie, some Mass
Effect N7 shoes and start making some games

on your Nintendo Dolphin/GameCube Development
System that you only need a $400 Development

Cart to start using. If your system crashes,
wipe away those tears with a tissue from your

Megaman Rush Plush Tissue Box because all
your files were saved on this Back to the
Future Delorean external hard drive.

Then celebrate by checking out these amazing
video game posters by Marinko Milosevski...

Or make your own work using Hexels. Hexels
is a free piece of software for Mac and Windows

that lets you easily create really cool pixel
art like this...

Now that you are an incredible artist, get
someone special this Metroid necklace, a triforce

skirt and some controller leggings. Make sure
you still have some money in your Companion

Cube Bank or grab this DIY Half-Life Gravity
Gun to lift up your Borderlands 2 Loot crate
to find more dollars.

Then blow it all on a Bioshock Infinite Songbird
Plushie, a laser engraved Donkey Kong barrel
keychain and some The Last of Us stickers.

And then put down your Minecraft mug and write
this on a Minecraft Sticky note because I

have a question...block lamp. This Mario inspired
lamp was featured in BiDiPi #13 originally released in 2012 for 5

months then taken off the market to be revised
and revamped. It is now on KickStarter so you can back your own. You tap the bottom to illuminate

it and it even rewards you with the sweet
sweet sound of coins.

But if you need something with more power,
try these incredible Superhero lights by 3DlightFX

that look like they are busting through the
wall...

And then cover up that giant hole with these
awesome comic book collages by Amy Watkins...

If you're feeling tired, get under your Zelda
throw, lay your head on this League of Legends

pillow, Subscribe to Vsauce3 for more Game
LÜT and remember...All My Pokemon have TM87.

Links to everything can be found in the description
below.
I'm Jake and as always, thanks for watching.

comments.text:
For the uncultured swines among you, TMs are special items found in the 
Pokemon world. They allow your pokemon to instantly learn a new move. In 
this case, TM 87 is a move called "Swagger". It's funny, because swag.﻿
